RDWSny5A74ktLZiR_1ptqQ.text: I was trying to make online reservation for dinner on 13th January but the website indicated N/A. I then called few times but transferred to auto voice machine. After few attempts finally a lady answered my call and made the reservation for us.  Went earlier than our schedule time and received a warm welcome from hostess. The food was delicious but some servers need more polishing in terms of talking to guests and body language, One server was pouring my glass with water while talking to another waiter at the other side. Some waitress are very attentive and polite while others seems to be blind when I was raising my hand to get their attention to Ask for water while my partner was coughing. Nice view and food but service needs a lift.

ArEuYbLtCL0ZDWFL8Wkq9Q.text: It was the mom in law's birthday and the missus wanted to treat her to a luxurious Sunday brunch. if you have ever tried looking for a good Sunday brunch, most of the recommendations are for hotel buffets. but if you, like the missus, are not fans of buffets because you simply do not eat enough to make it worth your while, then you will have trouble.That's when we discovered that Level33 serves Sunday roast - the wonderful English tradition of pubs serving Roast and other food on Sundays that still lingers fondly in my memory of England. Sunday brunch at Level33 had a quiet expensive bustle with mostly rich customers on the 33rd level of the marina bay financial centre. The view is quite spectacular but nothing compared to MBS or One Altitude of course. the food was decent for its price. it's handcrafted beers were ok but we had better. To be honest it was one of those places we would go once to experience it and see what the fuss is about and probably never go back again. But the girls had fun playing tourist and taking photos on the outdoor balcony. you will also get an entertaining, but not necessarily pleasant, view of scantily clad residents walking around Marina Bay Residences.

Rz3c0XrzfvMy2afeDL0pKQ.text: The view is spectacular of Marina Bay up here.  Only came for a drink and the view so couldn't say anything about the food. Nice atmosphere for a date.  I would come back.

y4A_ndlj-ZjdJCfv5Sb30g.text: Great view of Marina Bay sands and decent beer and great food.  We had their version of a charcuterie, sizzling beer and fish and some amazing bread and dips.  We had to wait for a table outside but the staff was good about not asking people to block us which was nice since we had waited an hour for a table with a view.But it all went downhill when we got the bill.  The reason we had sizzling beef and fish was because we had ordered the fish, but they brought us the beef.  For their mistake they let us keep the beef while they brought out the fish. They said no charge.  Of course, it ended up on the bill.  When I pointed it out the guy went back to fix it.  When he came back the charge was still on because he had "called his manager and his manager had said that we had ordered one in the first round and the other in the 2nd round."  There were no two rounds so I'm not sure if the server was lying or the 'manager' he called but regardless I said it wasn't acceptable and to take it off the bill.  He came back with it off but what is with that?  And then when we were paying cash and sorting it out, he was like "don't you think it'd be easier to put on your card?"  Felt very odd he was trying to force a credit card transaction.  The whole end was sketchy and ruined what had been a good night.  Unacceptable service.

KhiUziSj-AL1642HjDgtxA.text: amazing amazing views.  that fancy hotel with the pool on the roof really looks cool with your eyeballs and also in pictures.  also the servers were very accommodating.  we had reservations for 8 pm, showed up at 6pm, they seated us and never rushed us out.  service was attentive enough.  happy hour prices on their beers before 8pm - 300 mL and 500 mL sizes available.  beers were fine, i'm not much of a beer drinker but the happy hour prices seemed reasonable enough for singapore and also kinda a schwanky place.  it was filled with banker type looking people, a very ny looking scene but not too loud at all.  the food was actually pretty tasty, the lamb shoulder was super tender, flaked off the bone, had some really gigantic baby corns and i think shishito peppers and came with 5 sauces.  yeah it's a 100 bucks but it's a lot of food, 5 of us shared.  got two sides the leeks - which are difficult to slice and the cabbage which was many different leaves of leafy vegetable (i.e. one brussel sprout leaf) but actually super tasty and flavorful.  we also had the ploughman's board for two which had enough meat for 4 and the beef tartar.  i am told the beef tartar was good.  it reminded me too much of the walking dead so i couldn't eat it.  overall seemed like a classy place, beautiful views and they didn't rush us out.  we spent like 3.5 hours there.

I_V9wvKkGcRkf2UpCbxcow.text: 4- stars for the view....minus one for the food/drinks/price.I was only here for drinks. Heard enough bad reviews about the food for me to waste any calories here. It's a microbrewery and the beers are ok. nothing mind-blowing.Snag a table outdoor in the evening, and you will wow any guest that you bring there. Of all the rooftop bars surrounding the Bay, I think this place has the best view. Come in the evening and you can watch the sunset and the changing colors across the entire city. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. View of MBS from level 33

74tkuK1v0L0niXLwXQ5Q3g.text: LeVel33 claims the distinction of being the highest brewery at least in Singapore if not the world. The beer is actually very good including their seasonal brews. It is definitely a sign of the increasing popularity of micro and nano-breweries popping up in Singapore. If you head here for happy hour you can find the beer of your choice for a reasonable price and get a seat outside for the spectacular views of Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer and the ArtScience Museum. Definitely worth a visit!

VToZd_wVjflbW2OrHfJ5gQ.text: There was no way we could resist a visit to a brewery 33 stories above Singapore. The views are most definitely worth the visit. Possibly even better than at MBS, because you get to see the enormous building in all its glory, as well as its surrounds. As for the place itself? The beer is expensive and extremely bland. I'd take a Tiger over the offerings here for a fraction of the price. The food is just as bad, if not worse. Super expensive pub-fare, very bland. Honestly, all of this is to be expected. This place is all about the wow factor and they are hardly the first restaurant to capitalise on the tourist trade! We enjoyed our visit as a must-stop on our list and were happy to pay for the beer as the price of entry.

BjAKcu8XpxA1gMNbXc8f5Q.text: The Food - We had the Vday set meal so I am not sure if all the items listed here are on the regular menu. 1. Starters: - Fresh rolls with 3 different types of butter (love butter!!!)- Scallop (my favorite) & pork belly - Foie gras (excellent & Normally, I don't like this dish but this one was good. Whatever else I write will be an understatement for foie gras lovers so I'll stop here. 2. Mains: - Overall, quite disappointing especially after the spectacular starters. I have a feeling that this place excels in its niche - starters/finger food/desserts & (of course) cocktails/beers. However, not in their mains.  - The pan fried sea bass had a fishy smell that was not musk well which really irks me. Another big downer was that the fillet had so much small-annoying-hard-to-see bones in it. Beware! It was a chore to debone it and isn't worth the effort because it wasn't even that tasty to begin with. - Beef. I ordered mine medium-well. A precarious task because as most restaurants do not do this well. It comes often comes out over cooked (well-done). Level 33 was no exception. Also, they topped the steak with a strong cheese (melted on top of it) which really overpowered the flavor of the steak. The steak sauce was great but they gave too little of it, and whilst I tried to ration my meat to sauce ratio carefully in the end the sauce ran out before the meat. 3. Desserts: - Chocolate lava cake - Good! I love who they balanced out the sweetness of the chocolate with sea salt and cream cheese at the side. - Mascarpone - Great!!! even though they got our order wrong! We were suppose to have the banana dessert (whatever that was, it was recommended by our server) but this was excellent! I am a big fan of mascarpone so I might be biased. If you like cheesey-sweet treats like me, this one is definitely for you! 4. Drinks: - Excellent. I am not a big fan of beer. In fact, I NEVER order it. However, this microbrewery has changed my opinion. All their cocktails are beer based (I believe) and they were sooo good (with the exception of the stout. I am still, and forever will be NOT A FAN OF STOUT. The bitterness puts me off.) Even the plain beer alone is good. It has a really light taste, even lighter than Heikien.- Paris - Love x2! Very sweet though. - Blond mojito - Love x3. My favorite drink. - Beer - Love- Unknown stout cocktail with berries - Cannot Love, because of my predisposition to be biased against stout!!! The bf thought it was ok though. The Service - Good. The waiter was kind enough to throw in 2 free drinks. The first because I hinted it looked good. The second because our desserts took 45min to come. - Really appreciated their effort to be efficient. - They had a pre-set the dining table with a rose & a box of chocolates so definitely good news for the guys. Half the work has already been done for you. The View- It was AWESOME. Overlooking the entire marina bay :) How singapore has grown. I feel old already! - It's a bit chilly up there so definitely bring a jacket along. Overall: Will definitely be back here again with friends to grab a cocktail & snack on some starters.

cfhse3vO5fgbeDMvcxM0bw.text: Great taste of food, great atmosphere and an outstanding view of Marina Bay.

BNXYwar-Flge2U5pIwkQ1w.text: Amazing Foie Gras and beautiful view!

zZhWXW2ke2pdLB9iCHFHKQ.text: Decent beer, the view is the best part. Beers are not that bad in price about US$10. I didn't have any food, but overall good beer for it being in Singapore, which is not known for craft beers. I would go again for sure.

QV8uI2mIIVaBvRGHwrGFSw.text: I like to come to L33 occasionally for a drink or microbrew to relax and hang out for a while. It's okay and I find it kinda fancy how they for example serve a Gin Tonic with a mini bottle of Hendricks on a small board. That plus the check surely let's you get big eyes haha. But I guess it's ok. L33 has a nice view, the service is nothing special but then again there are not many places in SG where I find service to be excellent.I like their Executive Lunch when I'm into the Lunch thing every now and then. The quality is consistent. Due to it's location at the MBFC (Marina Bay Financial Center) this is a typical ExPat and Business Folk hangout as I experienced, convenient for a quick bite and drink in between or after work.Pay it a visit and get the picture! :)Cheers-s

0S5ODThwH5fgl-fMu5x05A.text: How much fun was this! It was a bit windy when we were up there but I loved taking the elevator up and then having a good IPA on the patio. We didn't eat--just sipped and enjoyed the view.

qx_QYT9qHLBpQdnPoli8Mg.text: This is the place to go if you are missing real american food in Singapore.  The steak is delicious!  Ask to sit outside and overlook Marina Bay and you can see the light show at night.  I was here for the final Formula 1 race a well which they showed on a large projector inside.  It was very cool to be able to see the track outside and watch the race at the same time.

Y6QGd-EakLAid4wtswXuOA.text: Quite average brewery with a phenomenal view of the bay. Went for a quick beer after work, but the seating wasn't open on the patio. Had the Blond Lager, which was average for a craft beer. The excitement of this place is relegated to the overall urban chic atmosphere and the outdoor seating. Not a place I'd return for the beers. I'd recommend visiting at night, catching the lights, and going for the food.

EPsDRMybqkkNiy5pTVv4EQ.text: The ambiance is on point complimenting the great view. Very chic! Food is good but slightly overpriced for what it actually is. Service can be improved.

gXnLB34nmgIhhq0R8eRlcw.text: Went just around 7 to wait for sunset. Lovely view but with prices to match. Definitely must check it out though!

fDRdjazGWnFsfDgjSb_llw.text: So there is the view...  Terrible service, mediocre food, awful beer.  Why people congregate here baffles me.  Plenty of better options.

0ghQWirE7ZC3DoZxsZUkQg.text: The blonde lager is great. The pale ale is just ok. Food wise the brunch was very American style with big portions and a wide selection of eggs. The burger is enormous and very well seasoned. Highly recommend the brunch salad with pork, chorizo and quail eggs, but get the dressing on the side a had a bit too much.

y2Tgv28D6xqKYXpJTOhm5w.text: The best view in the city, better than the Marina Bay Sands, mostly because you get to see the Sands from here. The beer is solid and the waiter ensured we paired our flight with just the right appetizers. Its called beer dining on the menu and we tried it all pretty much, my favorite thing was the rillettes trio, the beef was so good, and the beers cleansed my palette so well, keeping me eating the entire $110 worth of apps. But even if you just want to stop for one beer and the view its worth it. The staff was very welcoming at every level. I wish I worked in this building. Thank you level33

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. See?

ym_JVzPWMgycYDMZlS2diA.text: 5 Stars for the view, 3.5 stars for the food.  These views over Marina Bay from the outdoor patio are amazing.  Definitely worth the price of admission.I dined here with colleagues from work and had a fun time and a good meal.  The meal was not spectacular but it was tasty.  The views from atop Singapore are the reason to dine here.The wine selection is fairly good, I found several bottles of French wine that met the needs of our group nicely.  The wine list mostly consists of Australian wine which you would expect in this area of the world.I would come back again for a leisurely dinner with colleagues to take in the great views.

B7mXD54VQBV1iJHkQNw4uQ.text: Away from the tourist infested marina bay sands. Level 33 is a less crowded option with a spectacular view of the marina.  You can see at night random flashes from people's cameras at the merlion to the amazing laser light show of marina bay sands. Only part I mark off is that the staff assumed I was just their to enjoy the view and did not order my beer until I was pretty much ready to leave. But wow what a view. Go at night. You can see the heart of Singapore just buzzing from the 33rd story.  You see the lights of the garden by the bay and with Such a beautiful view. I forgot I needed a beer to enjoy myself. So where I would normally give a 2 I give this place a four.  Rule of real estate. Location location location and man what a location.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Beautiful view

xbeYSJhfhwkIm8e8LYB50w.text: You come here for the amazing view of Singapore at night, not the beer. They might brew their own beer here, but they really aren't very good at it. The beer is alright, but not interesting or worth the price tag. On top of that, I'm not sure that understand what an IPA is. Their Indian Pale Ale certainly haven't seen too much of the lovely hops. A pale ale, yes, but not indian.

rh0uLZhJ76pQc_E-WzrWFw.text: They have gotten some selections of beer, thought it is over priced for the view that you get - nothing outstanding in terms of selections either. Their food doesn't taste good at all - I have tried their platter, lamb, and pork and all of them were big disappointment.It's just conveniently located and thus I brought my leadership team and customer a few times, but a few visits have proven that it's not really a place to go for food. Atmosphere and the view are what you are paying the high price.

cWB5CgvSnr-Wk3_zF6wDug.text: A beautiful afternoon to have good food, good views n good chatting with friends.  The service is good too. This surely is one of the good choices for next gathering.

4sSUe2L-mgWr4Ngi13kYDg.text: Attitude clerk of women Poor...Clerk of the men was good guys.Scenery is good, beer is delicious. Even so I'm so sorry...

0DSNJphspmg3q0KEvUKPPA.text: This is my favorite go to spot for a view in Singapore.  You can get a great view of the light show at the Marina Bay Sands as well as the Gardens by the Bay.  The service is top notch. the best anywhere in Singapore.  I have been to some of the high end restaurants here and this place is A+++ on staff.  Food is always fresh and well presented.  Menu changes a bit but we always go for the Steak Tartare.  Just the best here. They brew their own beer, but you can also get the usual suspects of Tiger and Heineken.  I prefer their owne brew as its always tasty.  Do make reservations as the staff will give you the best spot in the house.  I am not a regular, but I do come as much as I can!  Way better than the other high dining, drinking spots in the area.

2EwEFLQnUZwgPI6qrDEWHw.text: Love this place. The beer is average but the food, service, and views are all top-notch. I especially recommend the Sunday Roast - amazing Yorkshire pud!

tBNlWYQXETig5_KA5UNanQ.text: This resto has the best view in singapore, better than one altitude and kudeta marina bay sands. Best time to come here is sunset time around 7-7.30pm to see the sunset and changing color of the sky and buildings. 5 stars for the view, always bring visitors to visit this place to enjoy the view with snacking and beer Food is mediocre, i would rate 2.5 stars for the food, it would be excellent if they can improve their food so it will match with the best view resto and have a great food as wellBeer - i love wheat beer, they house brew beers

Ix-wW1TNgelpOnMj2l3ImA.text: Went here recently on a business trip. Prices are higher here than in the U.S. but thought for the quality and ambiance that the price was reasonable. I had the chicken which was amazing and my co-workers had the steak. All entrees were incredible. We had the scallops and beef tartare for appetizers. The scallops were just OK. Nothing fantastic. But the beef was excellent. The view is amazing. I would most certainly come back on my next business trip.

yhSxAIzrQokPvMcakxwz8Q.text: Being at the Marina Bay Financial Centre, you can probably guess the type of crowd that congregates here - there's lots of groups of bankers coming straight from work, which gives the place a very smart atmosphere and you'd probably feel out of place (but not unwelcome) in more casual attire. The atmosphere was buzzing, and the view is outstanding.The craft beer here isn't anything to write home about - I ordered five samplers of ale and was a bit disappointed in the lack of diversity in the flavours between the ales. They're very conservative flavours, and the ales will be enjoyable by most. Hailing from the UK, though, I might be being a bit harsh compared to the selection I enjoy there.We interacted with at least three waitresses/waiters, and the I have to say, the service was absolutely phenomenal. They must have taken recent criticism of the other yelpers into account! The wait staff did a great job of helping us order the right amount for our party size and making sure the meals came on time. The food was great, but boy do you pay for it! It's overpriced, for sure, but it is pretty decent. The view is fantastic, and Level33 is definitely a great place to bring visiting friends to get a wonderful sunset view of the bay. Will I be visiting again for dinner without guests? Not really, as the price doesn't really justify the quality of the food to me.That said - the pre-8pm $13 for 500ml is a pretty good deal, so I'd highly recommend you visit for a drink, the view, and the ambience, at least.

mlxL9oaZEsoJsly7YtwW8A.text: food was average and expensive. Nice view over Marina bay...overall a good spot to grab beer with colleagues on Friday evening, not recommended for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Blonde & Dark Pale ale

knpf1ztjWY6oep_6EgLW3Q.text: Mid 30's international traveler walking around town with camera gear, hungry and thirsty. Went to Level 33Took Private ElevatorReceptionist didn't acknowledge me at all. Went to the balcony myself. No table so I stood in a clear section to look at the view. First thing waiter said to me when he saw me is "No Tripod" to take photos. I ask for a menu.Menu never came. I left with my camera, my tripod and my American Express.Went to a food center in China TownPigged outWent back to the hotel. Writing a review. GREAT VIEW from the balcony tho. Make sure you dress up.Don't bring your camera gear and act all touristy. LOLIt is a fancy place, but unfortunately too fancy for me...

lhnCNIiLT61iwTwpjCh2Xg.text: I'm a fan of this place for the amazing views. Definitely a cool spot to take a significant other on a romantic date or to impress clients at a business lunch/dinner.To be honest, I don't remember the food being bad at all. It's been a while since I last dined here but I thought the food was alright, the views spectacular.The service... hmmm again I don't remember how it was, but it wasn't anything horrible.Finally, the price. I don't remember b/c it was a work function, ha. This is a totally useless review. Go for the views!!!!

mUOUTJUNNhODd9vsGRG3qw.text: What a great view! You can see across Marina Bay and all the shiny lit up buildings that Singapore is famous for. I met up with a decently large group of friends here with a reservation for 2 tables outside. We tried to get moved to a smoking spot because we saw some were free, but they said it was all taken, so my friends were not able to have their cigars.The spot is very chic and modern. There's an elevator within the financial building that goes directly to the venue.We got the craft beer sampler, with 5 samples of their own beers, then got more based on what we liked. Overall, the beers were alright. I liked the blond. I did not like the stout or the mixed stout with the pale ale, which they said was one of the beers. Lots of color but not much flavor. I know Singapore has high alcohol taxes, but you think for like $20 the beer would be better than that.Anyways, a nice hangout spot, if a bit expensive. It does get a little windy up there.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. The skyline view from the top

_oYsqYaFyN44vkFkVVkmQA.text: Great service. Great view. Great time. F1 Thunder in background is icing on the cake . . .  A MUST visit while in Singapore.

fZ-Sr57zY6zxlndyREIcNw.text: A pretty awesome view, in fact one of my favorites in Singapore without requiring a cover charge. While a dinner here is pricy and I have only tried it once (was delicious). The drinks are very reasonably priced and their own craft beer and craft beer cocktails are well worth the visit. Sometimes the balcony gets rather crowded but usually you can get a table after 20-30 minute wait or can always enjoy the view and come back inside for drinks. Overall I highly recommend to visit here. In terms of food - I had the steak + shrimp combo dish and it was well prepared and presented though expensive!

yCkJxURDPNSrMmBaDxuupA.text: We came here for dinner and it was pretty unmemorable. The food that is. The view is awesome though. I would suggest to come here for a drink or two. Grab a table outside and enjoy the sunset.Bar food is decent. The mains are very average, not worth the price. Also the layout of the restaurant section is quite bad. Diners seated towards the window or middle could be hemmed in when it is full as all the chairs are back to back when seated, leaving no space for people to pass through. Not sure if that layout has changed now.

IC3vb7sLNbiUIo_DQj6TJQ.text: Very nice view of the city. Nice range of in house freshly brewed beers that go well with bite plates of sliders.Good value for money lunch buffet as well.

CTSrE4os5kzgxZe0LpVOaQ.text: LeVel33 is currently the World's Highest Urban Craft-brewery.  Enjoy a full food menu, craft beers, and/or crafted beer cocktails, with an amazing view of the Marina Bay and city skyline.  They also have a wine selection.  The restaurant has an awesome modern vibe, with warm wood tones.  A reservation is highly recommended to secure a spot here.  When you enter the large Financial Center building head to tower 1.  There will be a desk at the base of the elevators were you confirm your reservation and they will give you admittance to the elevator that heads straight to the restaurant.  The elevator will take you up 33 floors quickly (my ears popped). The doors open directly into the restaurant were you will be greeted by the smell of brewing beer.Their crafted brews are of European heritage and made using state-of-the-art technology by SALM & Co Gmbh. They have a 33.1 Blond Lager, 33.15 India Pale Ale, 33.3 Stout, 33.4 House Porter and 33.9 Wheat Beer, with seasonal brews on the menu.  You can see the beautiful copper kettles, and silver beer vats as you walk throughout the space.  You can order a beer paddle which gives you a 0.1 litre taster of five LeVeL33 craft brews (of your choice from the options available).  This is a perfect amount for sharing.  The seasonal Golden ale was the table favorite.  The other beers were OK.  Very 1 dimensional.  Lacked character or flavor.  Had a single flavor profile which made it pair well within their beer cocktails.  Their beer cocktails are unique and tasty.  I would highly recommend them as the way to go here for the price. The food menu highlights European classics with a twist. The food was GREAT.  Out of the sides our table favorite was the pumpkin.  The broccolini, corn, and heirloom tomato were also tasty.  The starters are also good.  The Ploughman's board was the best.  The seafood medley was OK.  I would definitely suggest the ploughman's board as the cured meats were addictively tasty.  I loved the crostini and rye bread that they came with.  Be sure to save room for the mains!Our table had a mix of different mains.  From fish, to the different options of gnocchi, to the Beef & Reef, and grilled meats.  Everything was cooked to perfection. The chevre gnocchi was OK, the original gnocchi was better.  The Beef and Reef was pricey, but good.  It is quite the show as they bring out the lobster and throw it in a pot of boiling water for a minute.  The meat cut like butter.  Amazing flavors and large portions.  You will leave full.  The prices are high. This would be a place for special occasions.  You pay for tasty food and excellent views.  Unfortunately, the beer wasn't great, but if you stick to beer cocktails or their other selection of drinks you will be OK.  With the large price tag you want to ensure you are getting something great.The service was friendly and prompt for Singapore.  .

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Seafood medley
Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Ploughman's board
Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Ploughman's board

3RDHUZBy6arl7Pvz_6LXDQ.text: This review is based on two visits. Both were very enjoyable evenings.The view from the restaurant/brewpub is quite extraordinary and is an obvious draw to LeVel33. There are other restaurants and bars with great views but you can't go wrong with a visit to the bar for a cocktail or brew.In addition to the bar, there are indoor and outdoor tables. The ambiance is interesting. It's  rather loud and appears to be a mix of after-work office workers and other patrons who go for the view. Overall, it's very pleasant. The staff on both occasions that I visited were very friendly and attentive. Service was excellent.It's a brewhouse and restaurant in one. I tried about 4 different beers. All were good but none were special. Like the beer, the food was good but it wasn't great. Unlike the beer, the food is pricey.Our steaks were cooked to order. The tenderloin was very good. The ribeye was very thin. It was definitely disappointing. I expect ribeyes to be triple the thickness of the steak that I was served. It was tasty but the flavor fell short of top notch steakhouses.My party split a Level33 Mess, which was a mess of shapes, colors, textures and flavors. It was good but nothing special. I think whoever created this dessert was trying too hard to come up with something different and unique.Prices are what you might expect for a restaurant with a view in the financial district of Singapore but not ridiculous given the restaurant's decor, service, and the view.It's worth a visit for the view, nice ambience, and good service. The food is decent too; just don't expect great food or beer.

-RFXaKNHheyeVu9YK_yJ5Q.text: We have the ultra lounge, Singapore has the sky bar or rooftop bar.Quintessential to the culture these bars are located on the top floors of office buildings.  They showcase incredible views of the city with both indoor and coveted outdoor seats.  Pricey mixed drinks and upscale bar food satisfy the up-and-coming youth and the well established alike.Level 33 has it all including incredible craft beer brewed on site.  The beer has a strong European influence. More classic malts and hops result in a cleaner, more restrained aroma and flavor than the in your face American style.On this visit, a very British style IPA. Extremely refreshing finishing only slightly better. Extremely clean on the palate. The stout, dark and brooding with excellent roasted grain notes and a sweet finish. Finally the wheat beer, very German in flavor. Unfiltered, beautiful citrus and banana notes, finishing sour.  Basically any of these beers could be bottled and sold as European. They're that good.All beer served in 0.3 L or 0.5 L pours.Note: prices increase on all drinks after 20:00.  Think of it as a nighttime view charge.Sadly no food sampled. I could not get my dining companion to eat the kangaroo or a dish called pig and snails.Excellent, proper service.Located in CBD, MBFC T1, 33rd floor.  Look for its separate elevator. Reservations recommended. It gets busy by 18:00.Note: despite how busy the taxi stand is,  it is incredibly difficult to hail a taxi.  Be sure to use Grab.And essential experience while visiting Singapore.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Beers brewed inhouse

FWiDf99yHm3oK_MnQoUnoA.text: My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at LeVeL 33 two days ago. The first impression was "great, they have mini brewery all the way up at level 33". The beer of course was refreshing and nice. I must say that the ambiance and view from level 33 looking out to the Singapore river and Esplanade was fantastic. Now come the food. Well,  I was a bit disappointed with the food as it  was just 'ok'. We ordered the Pig & Ssnail and Hokkaido Scallop for starters. The starters were fine. Unique mixture of the cream sauce blended well with the pork belly. The scallop was much nicer, again with good blending with the cream sauce. As for the mains, we ordered the Jumbo Prawns and Australian Bangalow Pork. The presentation was great but the they tasted as I mentioned earlier 'ok' only. They were pretty plain and "not enticing". The portion was more than enough for the both of us. As for the desserts, the mini chocolate lava cake was good. Not so much the same for the rest of the chocolate stuffs. Finally, their service. I must say the service was excellent. The staffs were firendly and they replace new clean plates after each course. In conclusion, if you are going there for the ambiance and the beer, that   would be a great place to go. If you are expecting great food, other places like Morton, Ruth Christ, Lawrey's might be a better choice.

IO-pt9UadzJIhYv1pxeImA.text: The place is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower One, with its one dedicated lift. It has a specular view overlooking the Marina Bay area. It also offer interesting choices of beer, but I did not try the beer on this visit. They offer set menu during lunch time. There is a buffer starter with choices of salads, pasta, cheeses, smoked salmon. Desserts are also part of the buffet. Not great but adequate. I chose the fish and chips for main course. The fish was quite 'skinny' and somewhat tough and dry. The chips are large sized ones. Between 3 or 4 stars; decided to be on a generous side, as the ambient is quite good and the view is appealing.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Impressive looking fish & chips!

9WkDrLSEo0nEnBhjwhnsVQ.text: My old co worker took us here.  The view alone is worth the visit. Lots of unique beers that they brew themselves.  I didn't try the food here but the view is breathtaking of Marina Bay. Definitely check it out!

XWk4r2gQgxbD2HWVHmKZOQ.text: Quick the interesting place. I went there mainly to try the beer, since back home in Bellingham WA, we have several craft breweries. I tried all 6 of there beers, 5 via a beer flight. All were good, their stout was probably my favorite, porter coming in second (porter is not in the picture though).The atmosphere was great and the view was absolutely amazing. I would definitely recommend visiting for a beer. There food looked delicious, all I had was a salad and their mushroom flight. Things started adding up fast so I didn't get a main course. It is rather expensive, but that's how it is in Singapore. Will definitely visit again during my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. The mushroom appetizer.

P8iXlPHZE9-590bHbJrmEw.text: I think this hits the sweet spot in terms of value for money and views of the singapore skyline. Has the worlds highest craft brewery which might sound a bit gimmicky but the beer is pretty good and if you get in before 8 its not even that expensive (~8-9 SGD). The view is staggeringly good, if you don't have a table, order a beer and head outside and enjoy the cold brew while you have the entire SP sklyline as a backdrop.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. That view

YwQ_IWp1Mxsmoh_pzswfVw.text: Honestly the best view of Singapore I've seen since my time living here. Yes drinks are 'pricey' --$13.33 for half liter, but with the incredible view outdoors (and my conversion of the prices to USD) it's completely worth it. My boyfriend and I came for drinks on a Friday around 6- no reservation and of course no seated table, but we managed to get a standing table right next to the viewpoint on a pleasant evening. Their beers were delicious and you can easily watch the gardens by the bay and marina bay light shows in the evening. Decided to get some appetizers to pick on while drinking- the lamb chops were relatively good, but the chicken winglets were not worth the cost. Great atmosphere- can't wait to return to try their pumpkin beer.

yWyYBBIQk-vUOIUWFhFsUQ.text: SUMMARY: Went for a work dinner with my team with a reservation. Service was excruciatingly slow and the food was "Meh. I've experienced better." The ambiance was very luxury/formal and the view was great, but would never go back nor recommend it - even on someone else's tab.WHAT I TRIED: Foie Gras + Seafood Medley + Ploughman's Board + Wagyu Steak + Red Wine-------------------MORE DETAIL-------------------FOOD: OK: Food was actually good, but not worth the price. There are so many better places for the price (and even for cheaper). I was very unimpressed with the food. The Ploughman's Board had a TON of meat, but no cheese or veggies and not enough bread/crackers - we didn't even get halfway through it despite having about 10 men in their 20s in the group! The Seafood Medley had a "meh" selection of seafood. The shrimp was good and that was about it. The wine and foie gras were good, but nothing special. I ordered the steak medium rare and it came out medium. It was too chewy, but it was flavorful.SERVICE: SUBPAR: This is some of the slowest and inattentive service I've ever had. We asked for water several times to several different waiters before half our table got water - and then the other half about 10 minutes later. I ordered a glass of wine, which was delivered to another woman in our party at the opposite end of the table - and it was only when I asked where mine was 20 minutes after ordering it that they said they had already given it to me.... except they had given it to her. AMBIANCE: GREAT: Topnotch luxury with a great view and beautiful interior. Very fancy.

rBPu7BF4IByjXt4qvVzD3w.text: Views are fabulous. I went during the afternoon and sat outside. The beer price was not any more expensive than anywhere else but the view was phenomenal. I ordered the pork belly which was good but not great. I found it interesting they make the beer in full view (and full smell) behind the bar. As anyone knows who's brewed their own, that sh&t smells nasty and they kept the door to exterior open most likely for that reason. I would absolutely recommend this place for a date night or a beer aficionado. I only had the IPA which could have been a little hoppier but it was still tasty.

0Hr2FI_gctdZpXtgFDlLyw.text: Been here a couple of times to unwind after work. They labelled themselves as the "world highest urban craft brewery" and man, actually the view up here is splendid! Take the inside seats facing outdoors, as it's really not that chill after all staying outdoors in this 365 summer Singapore.I chanced upon a post by a friend on the Saturday brunch buffet and decided to give it a try for my big boy's birthday. It's a minimalist brunch compared to the hotels buffet we usually come across, which I like about it as the selection is small but great individually! We made reservation through a 3rd party app, and the staff called to confirm my reservation the day before. On Saturday itself, we were held up by some errands on the morning which we called to delay our reservations twice, and the staff responded positively to our request and I'm truly thankful for that!The selection are very clear in 1 small confined area. Cold selection, hot selection, cheese, soup, desserts. That's all we've got. There's nothing international about the Saturday brunch. Cold selection includes salami, some seafood, salad. Hot selection includes foei gras, mini eggs ben, mini blue cheese quiche tartlets, roast beef, sausages, and 2 more dishes I couldn't recall. Desserts and cheeses are cluttered at one corner. Well, I'll pass the soup next time. Soup served on that day was a tomato relish sort of soup (well it's not labelled), and it tasted super salty which I stopped after 2 mouthfuls. There's also a selection of bread which you can choose to go with it. Apart from the soup, I love how all the rest are served so nicely.The highlight of the brunch is definitely their craft beers, beer cocktails, and special beer cocktails of the month! It's your a hardcore beer drinker, you can opt to top it up for the "beer buffet" version from the normal buffet price of $58++. Alternatively, you can order the beer separately. For a brewery, buffet and beer combination is definitely the way to go!One of the nays will probably go to the service. Staff do not give you much attention and you just gotta try your best to wave hard, or go up to them. My plates are not cleared promptly, neither was my water filled. I don't know if it's the privacy time which they are trying to give us, or they simply don't care. However, they are not rude la, still can make it.Finally, the view up here is a true win! We enjoyed the lovely view over brunch, which makes our Saturday slow paced and relaxed. They also live up to their name as a brewery for the tasty draft they served! It was an enjoyable weekend brunch which I'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Specially ordered before last serving of Saturday brunch
Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Desserts for Saturday brunch
Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Cheeses from old and new world for Saturday brunch

lhJv-rHbeiwy683AEg1hDQ.text: LeVeL33 has no cover charge like 1-Altitude and in my opinion, offers better views of MBS/Marina Bay, but does not offer 360 degree views of the city.  I personally preferred this chill spot over 1-Altitude.LeVeL33 specializes in craft beers, but I opted for a girly drink instead.  I ordered a skyline (gin, blueberry stuff, ginger beer, mint) which the bartender generously gave me for free for my birthday - he didn't even check my passport!  It was actually quite delicious and you couldn't taste the alcohol at all - perfect girly drink.Drinks here are pretty pricey at $20-30/pp for your craft beer and cocktails.  Unfortunately, I didn't try the food so I can't comment on that.Overall, I enjoyed the vibe and views of this lounge - definitely a good place for a fun and chill, but classy late evening.(They close pretty early, like midnight on the weekday)

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. The view

pnWsPoqy8Hx6KueU2cT8dQ.text: Ticking off the rooftop bars, we headed here largely because they have their own on-premise brewery. We managed to get a table (but no seats) at the balcony, ordered some snacks, and sampled their wares. Their own brew beers are good, on a par with some of the better craft beers I've tried, and whilst a little pricey due to the location it wasn't extortionate.Our food was good, a mix of sausage, hummus, and bread, and the service was top notch, very attentive and friendly.Obviously the view is the main attraction, it's one of the better views available, but I'd definitely go back to try the full menu.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. Reasonable view

c6YtRcpl9cP0mgqJzi6Qxg.text: I'd give this place a solid 4 star but their beer is just mediocre. With such high taxes being levied on alcohol in SG, I can't really complain about it as it's an uncontrollable factor. But at $22 a pint in the evening hours, you'd expect the beer to taste somewhat decent, considering the place claims to be a "craft beer" brewery. But it's no better than what you'd find in a 7-11 or such.One thing that's worth coming here for is the awesome view! And furthermore, the light show going on right across the water is one great thing to watch while you're here soaking in the backdrop. They didn't lie when they said it was the world's highest brewery at 33 levels above ground. Don't come here with hopes that you'll get a good beer craving satisfied. There are plenty of other places in town that offer better tasting beer just in bottles. But it's totally worth it to come just for the view alone, which makes up for their average tasting brewskies.

FbOKJZg_T4QBTMovXUJiRg.text: Disclaimer- tourist review. Get here early or else everyone will take up the prime spots outside with the gorgeous view. Luckily a group of us 4 came and snagged a pretty nice spot and was able to take awesome pics. Great beer and wine selection and we all just had 2 each. Of course I can't remember (not very useful, sorry) what I got but there was a pretty strong stout that was really really good. Really liked the ambiance of the entire place. It was obviously more upscale and the prices reflected that. Service could get a bit tricky at times but not a big deal. Didn't get a chance to order food except little nuts and olives. I didn't get to dress up very much in Singapore since most people dress pretty casually but this is the one place where I could have and fit right in. I was actually a bit surprised by such a different crowd of people than what I had seen all week walking around. Anyhow, that's from a  tourist POV!

2M7tEd2CWInGeZZ4vPU1OQ.text: Just wow!  Take the direct elevator up.  Sunday they run a great brunch.Views from this place are unbeatable.  Good crowd and unique beer brewed on site.  Note to self:  Try the peppered  chocolate fondant....looks awesome!

lvZfPV9-eChB2hzF8smprA.text: Spectacular view! You can see the whole of Singapore from up here! The wine selection is amazing! The scallops were delicious! We went for a office event and the entire atmosphere was fun! The service was a bit slow but they made it up with the amazing food!

v6Rj9Wx4qRKvttmVpDslZA.text: nice, chill place to hang out with a glass of wine - and have a dessert (or two). this local microbrewery is pretty top-of-its-class, with a view up on its place on the thirty-third floor (the name's a no-brainer, really), with a good selection of food and drinks, a good mix of standing and sit-down space - and it feels pretty cozy, even with the throngs of people that come here post-work.I'd like to talk about their desserts too (a proper meal here is still a pending to-do) - and in particular, this interpretation of a sticky date pudding with triangular block of cake topped with a fig compote and goat's cheese caramel. it's a subtly sweet cake that plays up to the sharp savoriness of the goat's cheese (which isn't something I usually eat, but this was properly moderated), and the soft vanilla ice cream on the side.very pretty, very modern, and a well-portioned plate of enough sweet to sate without cloying.I've also tried their fondant previously, and it's pretty good too - but I'm working my way up to the assiette, which is a two-person platter of dessert. I could really do with one right now.p.s. it's a nice view outside, but too damn hot. I'll stick with the aircon.

photos.caption: Photo of LeVeL33 - Singapore, Singapore. caramel and goat's cheese

LnRtyQg5ebt15vmaLSRMEw.text: Here's an alternative place to view enjoy the beautiful Singapore skyline without having to push and shove against too many people. While it's best to book for the outdoor seat, you should be able to get a standing table after 9PM. Service is usually great as well!They have a variety of beer to choose from. If you can't decide, order the sampling set first. I haven't tried their food nor their cocktails, but they look decent.
